sub_title: Contract engineer: Software, Molecular Biology, Electronics, Aging Research (USA & the Netherlands)
summary:
- Highly experienced software and embedded systems engineer with degrees in: Molecular Medicine, Biochemistry & Biophysics and Computer Science.
- Extensive real-time, embedded systems and hardware design experience, including medical devices and communication equipment. 
- US citizen with valid Dutch residence/work permit
- Looking for new customers/projects in either the Netherlands or USA (June 2017). 

Current internal project(s):
- Aging research: developing software in R for a novel form of RNA sequencing data analysis.

Examples of past project work includes:
- Web and user interface - part of a small team which created an integrated server for online customer ordering, production management and product shipment.
- Performance optimization - designed a new algorithm to reduce computational time by between one and two orders of magnitude on a processor which failed to meet real-time requirements.
- Memory optimization - reduced memory requirements on a data acquisition system by 40%, greatly increasing its data buffering capabilities.
- Code cleanup/refactoring - rewrote a kidney dialysis machine, converted 130,000 lines of  C to C++, reduced source code by 40% and made the software far easier to  maintain.
- Hardware - designed a PCB which plugged into an existing CPU socket to provide a field installable fix for multiple hardware design errors in a communication system.
- I have written well over a hundred device drivers for new and existing embedded systems and desktop computers, as well as debugging problems with numerous drivers written by other developers.

For additional information, see below, visit my company web site at: www.deatech.com or contact me: dealy@deatech.com

When I'm not doing Software, Biology or Electronics:
- Natural building instruction and talks on environmental and lifestyle issues. Primarily cob (earthen building) and ultra high efficiency wood stoves (rocket stoves).
- Martial arts: Brazilian Jiu Jitsu and Tae Kwon Do

organizations.name: Dutch Society for Research on Ageing (DuSRA)

profile_positions.location: Delft, Netherlands and Philomath, Oregon USA
profile_positions.description:
Embedded systems, Medical, Biotechnology and Scientific software development services.

See other entries below for contract work history.

- DeaTech Research Inc. - internal and personal projects  1983-present:
C++ programming and debug of a RepRap 3-D printer. 
Designed a co‑processor for the MC68020 to virtualize other processor architectures. 
Created a program in C and Java for nutritional and agricultural analysis using genetic algorithms.
Ported FIG Forth to the Z8 microcontroller. 
Currently developing health optimization software using Python and Django.

From the beginning, DeaTech Research has run on UNIX based systems, switching to Linux as the primary operating system in 1994. Maintaining servers on the Internet and additional systems in the office for over 20 years has given me a great deal of experience with Linux custom kernels, virtualization, device drivers, shell scripting, networking and security.

My work at DeaTech Research has also included a great deal of time spent on natural building and environmental issues.
profile_positions.title: President

profile_positions.description:
- Department of Molecular Genetics - Aging Research Group: 
Worked on the development of two new techniques for measuring changes in accumulated DNA damage. Performed UV DNA damage experiments and created software in R to perform an novel form of RNA sequencing data analysis. Also made extensive use of Make and shell scripts on Linux for this project. Initial work performed as a master's degree internship, I am currently continuing and expanding on this work as a guest researcher.

- Department of Cell Biology - Stem Cell Institute: 
Used flow cytometry, PCR and immunostains, as well as RNA sequencing data analysis in order to examine differences in how BMP4, WNT and 2I maintain naive pluripotency in mouse embryonic stem cells (molecular medicine degree internship).
profile_positions.title: Guest Researcher

profile_positions.description: Worked as part of a small team to create, maintain and perform upgrades on an integrated web based e-commerce and production management system using Drupal, PHP and MySql. I was responsible for writing most of the core classes that managed user data input, validation and database access. Also wrote the software for managing packing and shipping of orders including interfacing to the FedEx computer systems for domestic and international shipping. Most recently, converted the shipping software from the FedEx tagged transaction API to their newer web services API and updated the software to work with Drupal 7.
profile_positions.title: Independent Contractor

profile_positions.description:
- Hays' DNA Repair and Mutagenesis Lab:
Performed DNA mutation experiments on genetically engineered Arabidopsis plants and wrote software in Perl for analysis of sequencing data.
profile_positions.title: Undergraduate internship

profile_positions.description: Developed an Adobe Acrobat plug-in in C++ which uses OCR technology to identify any one of over 8,000 standard forms in a document and bookmark each page accordingly.
profile_positions.title: Independent Contractor

profile_positions.description: Created an Adobe Flash compatible version of Pajaggle's board game products to be used as a marketing tool for online product promotion.
profile_positions.title: Independent Contractor

profile_positions.description: Created device drivers in C for a newly developed ARM-7 processor board used in the trucking industry. Drivers included: UARTs, SPI, I²C, EEPROM, A-D converters, timers and digital I/O. Provided debugging support for finding problems with their existing software and hardware.
profile_positions.title: Independent Contractor

profile_positions.description:
Developed a web server platform using Java servlets, Java Server Pages (JSP) and a PostgreSQL database back end, which provided Internet access to an RF data acquisition network. Features included secure command interface to the radio relay units, web based system administration and status monitoring, configuration of data acquisition parameters, security protocols to allow customers to only access data and configuration for their units and user configurable data report generation / display. Worked with MCC's software developers to create system and software specifications; designed and coded all of the server software; configured and installed a Linux based server platform.
Created device drivers and hardware diagnostics in C and assembly language for a MC68332 microcontroller to manage an RF data communication link.
Analyzed a network of 8051 micro controllers controlling an RF communication link for causes of performance problems and numerous bugs. Made major software changes (in 8051 assembly and PLM-51) and devised field installable modifications to fix the hardware bugs, increasing system throughput to more than four times its best prior data rate.
Other projects performed for Meteor Communications include: development of test/diagnostic software for use in PC board manufacturing; custom QNX device driver written in C for data acquisition; debugged several existing products, correcting a number of core hardware and software design problems; developed software to interface a GPS unit to a data communication system; ported a data acquisition and RF communication program to a new hardware platform; re-designed and coded software on a data acquisition unit to reduce memory consumption by 40%.
profile_positions.title: Independent Contractor

profile_positions.description: Modified software written in PIC assembly language (MPASM), for a pellet stove control system. Changes included finer timing resolution and more flexible sequencing for the ignition system.
profile_positions.title: Independent Contractor

profile_positions.description: Designed and coded scripts to perform automated testing of a critical care, patient monitoring unit.
profile_positions.title: Independent Contractor

volunteer_experiences.description: Cob Cottage Company teaches people how to build houses using the natural materials at hand (earth, straw, stone, etc.). This not only helps people to provide themselves with housing they may not otherwise be able to afford, but by using local, natural materials, eliminates most, if not all of the pollution created in the construction of modern housing. Through my business, I have donated web development, computer services, and web hosting to Cob Cottage Company since the mid 1990's. I have also on occasion assisted them in course preparation and as a guest speaker discussing my experimental work on earthen buildings and off-grid living.
